```{r}
#| echo: false
#| results: asis

library(htmltools)

# 1. Define your links here
my_links <- list(
  github   = "(https://github.com/graysonmedico)",
  linkedin = "(https://www.linkedin.com/in/grayson-medico-491ab7381/)",
  email    = "mailto:graysonmedico@gmail.com",
  x        = "(https://X.com/graysonmedico)"
)

# 2. Define the Custom "Field Theme" CSS
# This makes the buttons Green initially, and "Clay" Orange when you hover
css_style <- "
<style>
.btn-field {
  display: inline-flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: 10px;
  background-color: #2E5A38; /* Outfield Green */
  color: #FDFBF7 !important; /* Cream Text */
  padding: 12px 24px;
  border-radius: 8px;
  text-decoration: none;
  font-weight: bold;
  font-family: sans-serif;
  transition: all 0.3s ease;
  border: 2px solid #2E5A38;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
}

.btn-field:hover {
  background-color: #C25E00; /* Infield Clay (Hover) */
  border-color: #C25E00;
  transform: translateY(-3px); /* Moves up slightly */
  box-shadow: 0 6px 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.15);
  color: #ffffff !important;
}

.btn-container {
  display: flex;
  gap: 15px;
  flex-wrap: wrap;
  justify-content: center; /* Center buttons */
  margin-top: 20px;
}
</style>
"

# 3. Create the HTML for the buttons
# We use Bootstrap Icons (bi) which are built into Quarto
buttons_html <- div(
  class = "btn-container",
  
  # Github Button
  a(href = my_links$github, class = "btn-field", target = "_blank",
    tags$i(class = "bi bi-github"), "GitHub"),
    
  # LinkedIn Button
  a(href = my_links$linkedin, class = "btn-field", target = "_blank",
    tags$i(class = "bi bi-linkedin"), "LinkedIn"),
    
  # Email Button
  a(href = my_links$email, class = "btn-field",
    tags$i(class = "bi bi-envelope-fill"), "Email"),

  # X (Twitter) Button
  a(href = my_links$x, class = "btn-field", target = "_blank",
    tags$i(class = "bi bi-twitter-x"), "Socials")
)

# 4. Render it
cat(css_style)
print(buttons_html)
```
